incidents.name: We have scheduled maintenance that will affect Veho’s performance.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The Veho carrier is currently undergoing a change in their API which will bring down our service with Veho temporarily. We are expecting this maintenance to finish around 8AM PST on April 1, 2025.
FedEx API performance has remained stable and at normal baseline levels for over the past hour. We are considering this issue resolved and will re-open this incident if issues resurface.
FedEx API performance and error rate has improved and the situation appears to be resolving. We are continuing to monitor.

The FedEx API is experiencing elevated rates of errors and request timeouts for rating. FedEx has been notified and our engineers will continue to monitor the performance of the API.

Message from FedEx:
We are experiencing an issue that started around 12:12pm CT today that is causing certain functions to operate slower than usual or be temporarily unavailable.  Our IT teams are working diligently to identify and resolve the problem.  We regret any inconvenience this have caused.
This incident has been resolved.
Issue has been identified and resolved.  API error rate has recovered to normal levels. Will continue to monitor.
Underlying cause has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are experiencing elevated 500 errors on the EasyPost API. We are currently investigating.

incidents.name: UPS OAuth issues causing elevated UPS failure rates

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented by UPS, we continue to monitor.
The issue has been identified as degraded response times from the UPS OAuth API. UPS is investigating.

The UPS MI service has been stable since 6:17 PM PST. We consider this
incident resolved but will continue to monitor its performance.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
EasyPost is seeing issues with the UPS MI. We are investigating and communicating with UPS and will provide updates. We apologize for the inconvenience.

incidents.name: Customers are currently unable to access EasyPost reports due to a database issue. The EasyPost team is actively working to resolve the problem.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
At this time, the EasyPost Reports system is back online, though latest reports may be delayed.  The EasyPost team will monitor until all reports have been updated.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
This incident has been resolved.

Due to the ongoing delays from the recent Canada Post strike, all postal exports to Canada, including the dispatch of postal items, remain suspended. As a result, shipments via USPS to Canada cannot be created until further notice.

EasyPost is actively monitoring the situation and will provide updates as they become available.

Canada Post is scheduled to resume operations on December 17, 2024. We have removed the block on generating USPS labels to Canada through our platform. However, due to the 32 days of the strike, there is a significant backlog of parcels waiting for delivery. Canada Post is estimating that it may take up to two weeks to clear the backlog.

https://globalnews.ca/news/10919918/canada-post-strike-return-work-order/

We are monitoring a mail service disruption caused by an ongoing strike at Canada Post. This disruption is impacting various carriers that offer delivery services in Canada.

As a result, mail and package deliveries in Canada may experience delays until the strike is resolved. Additionally, some carriers may not allow shipment creation at this time.

EasyPost is closely observing the situation and will provide updates as more information becomes available.
The incident has been resolved, and it has been ~55mins since the last observed Label Broker error. USPS Label Broker® is fully operational.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

A fix has been implemented. Some users may see “Refresh Token Invalid - Resetting OAuth Status. You must reauthenticate.” Users who receive this message should re-authenticate and retry their request.

This incident has been resolved.

Engineers have deployed a change to automatically reset the OAuth status of affected accounts when users attempt to rate or buy using those accounts.

Users may see “Refresh Token Invalid - Resetting OAuth Status. You must reauthenticate.” Users who receive this message should re-authenticate and retry their request.

A fix has been put in place for the affected accounts. If you are having issues with any UPS operations, please log into the EasyPost Dashboard and re-authenticate your UPS account. This should resolve any remaining issues.
We have identified an outage affecting all actions for some UPS accounts and are actively working to fix the issue.
